thread.title: Nets trade Bojan Bogdanovic to Wizards for veterans, draft pick

author: Jeff Zillgitt
title: Nets trade Bojan Bogdanovic to Wizards for veterans, draft pick
text:

Join the Nation's Conversation To find out more about Facebook commenting please read the Conversation Guidelines and FAQs Nets trade Bojan Bogdanovic to Wizards for veterans, draft pick Jeff Zillgitt , USA TODAY Sports 4:16 p.m. ET Feb. 22, 2017 Brooklyn Nets guard Bojan Bogdanovic (44) shoots during the fourth quarter against the Cleveland Cavaliers at Barclays Center. (Photo: Anthony Gruppuso, USA TODAY Sports) CONNECT COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
The Washington Wizards need depth, and the Brooklyn Nets need draft picks. 
On Wednesday, the Wizards traded forward Andrew Nicholson, guard-forward Marcus Thornton and a 2017 first-round pick to the Nets for shooting guard Bojan Bogdanovic and forward Chris McCullough, two people with knowledge of the deal told USA TODAY Sports. 
The people requested anonymity because they were not authorized to speak publicly until the deal is official. 
The 2017 first-round pick going to the Nets from the Wizards is lottery protected, so it’s just about guaranteed given Washington’s position in the Eastern Conference that the Nets will get the pick in the June draft. The Nets will also have Boston’s first-round pick (Boston has Brooklyn’s), giving the Nets two first-round picks that will fall in 20s.
